attributes.action: Limit the PCN that councils and congestion charge companies can set to a more proportionate amount of the offence.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Councils don't make it easy to pay for parking and congestion charge. In other countries (e.g. Singapore) charges are deducted from an account automatically, here it becomes a tax on memory. Some parking meters don't give change or take cards (even the big ones in some parking lots) - one has to pay more and predict how long they will stay.

Paying for these 'services' is expensive anyway, so it is often shocking to have a PCN. Especially when the PCN has no amount limit and is worded like a blackmail (the jist being pay up quick or pay double).

In London, one is forced to pay the congestion charge if one uses a car.  Residents pay £0.80 a day, but will be charged £100 for forgetting to pay (same amount as for non-residents) - 125 times the original amount. If it was paid the next day the penalty is £10 - 12.5 times the amount. This is completely out of proportion with the 'offence'.

There should be a limit on any/all penalties exacted by councils and congestion charge companies.
